description.value: Factor to convert ADC counts to volts
Enable channel for the acquisition. When the channel is disabled, it doesn't give any data and its self-trigger is off.
Get a 32 bit word representing the status of the channel
Samples over thredhold for channel suppression
Threshold for channel suppression. Configuration parameters TriggerThrMode and SelfTriggerEdge shared with TriggerThr.
A constant DC offset (controlled by a 16 bit DAC) is added to the analog input in order to adjust the position of the signal baseline.
Dimensionless value to convert ADC counts to volts
Determine if the channel partecipate to ITLA or ITLB.
Veto width to discard triggers when crossing the threshold in the opposite direction to the trigger one
Samples over threshold
Number of triggers in the previous second. Reset every second.
The self-trigger can be issued on either the rising or falling crossing of the threshold. Used also by ChSupprThr.
Width of the self-trigger. 0 means linear mode
Offset of the input signal.
Threshold value in ADC counts. The value is relative to the baseline.
Defines whether the trigger threshold is relative to the baseline or absolute. Used also by ChSupprThr.
For test purposes, it is possible to replace the ADC data with internal data generators.
Factor to convert ADC counts to volts

The self-trigger can be issued on either the rising or falling crossing of the threshold. Used also by ChSupprThr.
Width of the self-trigger. 0 means linear mode
Offset of the input signal.
Threshold value in ADC counts. The value is relative to the baseline.
Defines whether the trigger threshold is relative to the baseline or absolute. Used also by ChSupprThr.
For test purposes, it is possible to replace the ADC data with internal data generators.
Factor to convert ADC counts to volts
Enable channel for the acquisition. When the channel is disabled, it doesn't give any data and its self-trigger is off.
Get a 32 bit word representing the status of the channel
Samples over thredhold for channel suppression
Threshold for channel suppression. Configuration parameters TriggerThrMode and SelfTriggerEdge shared with TriggerThr.
A constant DC offset (controlled by a 16 bit DAC) is added to the analog input in order to adjust the position of the signal baseline.
Dimensionless value to convert ADC counts to volts
Determine if the channel partecipate to ITLA or ITLB.
Veto width to discard triggers when crossing the threshold in the opposite direction to the trigger one

Resets the board. This command sets all registers to the default value and clear data from memories.

Stop the acquisition, provided that the option SWcmd is enabled in the parameter StartSource.
